dialogs.text: But I had to adapt to life as if I was blind. I use a blind stick to get around. I can tell the difference between different coins just by how they sound. I've learned to read Braille, but when people find out I’m not blind, they either think I’m crazy or they think I’m a joke.

segments.text: But I had to adapt to life as if I was blind.
I use a blind stick to get around.
I can tell the difference between different coins just by how they sound.
I've learned to read Braille,
but when people find out I’m not blind,
they either think I’m crazy or they think I’m a joke.

dialogs.text: It’s hard to describe the constant feeling of being scared.

segments.text: It’s hard to describe the constant feeling of being scared.

dialogs.speaker: A
dialogs.text: I live in a perpetual state of terror. It’s like closing your eyes to the scary parts of a horror movie, but for me, I kept them closed. I’ve seen many therapists over the years. Some have gotten close to helping me overcome my fear, but there is one major obstacle.

I’ve seen many therapists over the years.

dialogs.speaker: A
dialogs.text: I’ve been attending a support group for the past five years, and throughout those years, people would come and go.

segments.text: I’ve been attending a support group for the past five years,
and throughout those years,
people would come and go.

dialogs.speaker: A
dialogs.text: Normally, to overcome your fear, you need to face what it is you are scared of. The success rate for this is high, but how can I face my fear if I’m too scared to open my eyes long enough to face it?

dialogs.speaker: A
dialogs.text: "It's like I have a picture of the creature seared into my brain and I can still see it even with my eyes closed. His eyes were bright red and filled with a murderous hunger,” I explained. My hands were shaking and I could feel beads of sweat roll down my back.

aligned_script: A | 0 | 4580 |  The sound of my therapist's voice had changed to a more concerning tone.
B | 10443 | 14163 |  “Are you sure it wasn’t a man and not an animal?”
A | 14710 | 15610 |  “It wasn't a man.
A | 16210 | 17350 |  It was some kind of beast.
A | 18310 | 20230 |  People don’t move the way the creature moves.
A | 21050 | 22710 |  And when it was done with my parents,
A | 23210 | 24750 |  it started to move towards me.
A | 25590 | 30530 |  I was struck with a paralyzing fear and couldn’t do anything but close my eyes.
A | 31490 | 33870 |  I wasn’t sure how long I was sitting there,
A | 34430 | 36050 |  but the police eventually came,
A | 36650 | 38590 |  and I haven’t opened my eyes since.”

dialogs.speaker: A
dialogs.text: The sound of my therapist's voice had changed to a more concerning tone.

segments.text: The sound of my therapist's voice had changed to a more concerning tone.

dialogs.speaker: B
dialogs.text: “Are you sure it wasn’t a man and not an animal?”

segments.text: “Are you sure it wasn’t a man and not an animal?”

dialogs.speaker: A
dialogs.text: “It wasn't a man. It was some kind of beast. People don’t move the way the creature moves. And when it was done with my parents, it started to move towards me. I was struck with a paralyzing fear and couldn’t do anything but close my eyes. I wasn’t sure how long I was sitting there, but the police eventually came, and I haven’t opened my eyes since.”

segments.text: “It wasn't a man.
It was some kind of beast.
People don’t move the way the creature moves.
And when it was done with my parents,
it started to move towards me.
I was struck with a paralyzing fear and couldn’t do anything but close my eyes.
I wasn’t sure how long I was sitting there,
but the police eventually came,
and I haven’t opened my eyes since.”

dialogs.speaker: A
dialogs.text: The sensation was probably what a blind person would experience when seeing the world for the first time. My eyes stung as they adjusted to what light was in the room. It took a few moments for my eyes to come into focus before I could see my therapist's soft, reassuring eyes.

reassuring eyes.
